summary: A simple and inviting Breezhome. No clutter, no enchanting and no alchemy lab. Decoration can be bought from the steward in Dragonsreach like before.
descriptionHtml:
[size=5]Description[/size]

This is a simple lore-friendly Breezehome mod that makes the Dovahkiin's home in the central Whiterun a worthy abode, while not upgrading it too much.
All decorations are purchasable from the steward in Dragonsreach, like before (instead of war room it might say "alchemy lab" in the dialogue, I just didn't want to alter anything other than Breezehome).

[youtube]--isNb0uJfs[/youtube]
[i](Inlined the video, for people who don't click on the Video tab...)[/i]

[size=5]Updates[/size]

I have cleaned the file (previously required masters included Dragonborn and Dawnguard for some reason, but no longer), but didn't alter anything.
This was previously known as Parochy's Breezehome, but I changed my user since.

[size=5]Requirements[/size]

You need Hearthfire.
You shouldn't have any other mod that alters the Breezehome interior. This includes lighting mods, such as "RLO City Interiors".


[size=5]Features[/size]

[list][*]A cozy feel with correct navmeshing (NPCs will walk around objects)
[*]Items intended for decoration are static (you can't knock them over or take them)
[*]Non-respawning storage (everything, including the barrels)
[*]Talos shrine on a large working bookcase
[*]Oven
[*]Cooking pot
[*]Separate master bedroom with a washing area, and a small office with a hidden safe behind a working bookcase
[*]Mannequin
[*]Weapon racks (2 at the entrance, 1 in the loft)
[*]Lydia's room is downstairs
[*]Upstairs you will find either a war room or (if you so choose) the kid's room
[/list]

[size=5]Not Included[/size]

There is no enchanting table (I use one added next to the Skyforge instead, from a different mod), and no alchemy lab (for my rare alchemical practices I use Arcadia's shop). If more people request it however, I might be inclined to add it.


[size=5]Installation[/size]

Simply extract the archive to your Skyrim Data folder and enable the Breezehome.esp in your game's launcher.
The load order doesn't matter.


[size=5]Requests[/size]

I'm purely sharing the mods I made a long time ago. I don't intend to change them, since I like them the way they are. If you find bugs however, I might take a look. Other than that, no one's stopping you from making requests, and in the same manner I'm also not required to heed them.
I will not alter the lighting however, since I intentionally made light sieve through the roof, cuz I think it's pretty.
author: Dalakyne
